alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 7:38AM CST until further notice by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Franklin TN, Lincoln and Moore. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring across southern middle Tennessee, media has reported flooding and water over several roads. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible across Lincoln, Franklin and Moore counties. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester, Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Cowan, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee, Lois, Marble Hill, Hurdlow, Mulberry, Smithland, Booneville, Lexie Crossroads, Harmony, Kelso, Mimosa and Molino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
